headline.main: FROM NEWPORT.; Another Gala Day--The Masonic Fraternity Celebrate Sr. Joan's Day--Oration and Dinner--Newton and the "Atlantic"--First Arrivals--Improvements at the Redwood-- Corrected List of Summer Cottages Rented --Newport to be the Popular Resort. ATLANTIC HOUSE, NEWPORT, ORATION THE DINNER

docs.lead_paragraph: Newport has had another celebration to-day, in the annual festival of the Masonic Fraternity. Flags are flying, and the town is full of country people, come in on the excursion boats, of which the beautiful Narragansett Bay is so thronged during the Summer season. According to Masonic tradition, this day became a festival in 1741, and is intended to com-...

headline.main: ARRIVAL AT NEW-YORK.; Scenes in the Bay and on the Wharves. The Start for the City. Police Reports. Coroners' Inquests. Fires.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival of the Great Eastern, and the demonstrations of welcome which signalized the event, will make yesterday a day long to be remembered in the annals of New-York. The telegraph announced her arrival off the bar at about 7 o'clock, and as the intelligence became generally known in the City, there uses a spontaneous movement of all classes towards the Battery and other prominent points, in anticipation of her coming. It soon became

docs.snippet: The Great Eastern sailed from Southampton on the morning of Sunday, June 17, and arrived off Sandy Hook at 7:20 A.M., on the morning of the 28th. She brings 38 passengers and 8 guests.

headline.main: THE GREAT EASTERN.; First Voyage of the Vessel to the United States. COMPLETE ACCOUNT OF THE TRIP. PERFORMANCES OF HER ENGINES. Full Engineering and General Details. SECOND DAY. THIRD DAY. FOURTH DAY. FIFTH DAY. SIXTH DAY. SEVENTH DAY. EIGHTH DAY. NINTH DAY. TENTH DAY. ELEVENTH DAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Great Eastern sailed from Southampton on the morning of Sunday, June 17, and arrived off Sandy Hook at 7:20 A.M., on the morning of the 28th. She brings 38 passengers and 8 guests.
